class_notes:
(Freshmen Only)
(Same as CL 190 2)


This course approaches Roman history from "below" by focusing on (re) constructing the lived experiences of the non-elite. In this course, we will see every day people come alive through the critical engagement of scholarly works, as well as a critical investigation of sources as varied as inscriptions, graffiti, papyri, legal documents, art, archaeological materials, and a wide range of literary texts.
course_description: Introduces first-year students to the discipline of history, particularly historical sources and methods; aims to improve critical reading, analytical, and writing skills in small group discussion.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3311, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: J. Liu, Status: Closed
